intro: Isauxis, commonly known as the golden star, is a flowering plant native to the southern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features bright yellow ray florets surrounding a central disk of smaller, tubular flowers. Isauxis typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as prairies and disturbed soils. Its botanical structure supports pollination by bees and other insects, contributing to its ecological significance.
